author: costin
msg: Again, I hope I'm not braking too much in the build system.
Use VPATH to resolve the dep between foo.lo PWD/../common/foo.c, this way
you can compile files with Apache2.0 settings and Apache1.3 settings
without mixing one with the other.
Well, I think that's how it worked before, but somehow libtool got
confused at one point when trying to link the .lo files from ../common.

author: costin
msg: I think now it's better, still no idea why -rpath is so important or why

author: costin
msg: I changed the build for .so module from apxs to libtool.
The problem with apxs is that it recompiles _every_ .c file - if that's what
we want you don't need make.
Also make sure java is included corectly.
If someone can check I didn't make something stupid, it would be great.

author: costin
msg: Integrate the JNI library to the configure system.
